name: Follow Up on Missing Documents
description: Remote administrative assistant is waiting for important documents from a client and needs to follow up politely and clearly.
counterpart_role: HR coordinator at a partner company
student_task: You are a remote administrative assistant. You need three documents from HR coordinator Emily Ross at a partner company to complete an onboarding report for a new hire who starts on March 3rd: (1) the signed I-9 employment verification form, (2) the direct deposit authorization form, and (3) the emergency contact information sheet. Emily mentioned last week that she would send them soon, but you still have not received anything. Your manager needs the completed report by February 28th. Write a follow-up email to Emily. Politely list the three documents you need, explain briefly why they are important and when you need them, and ask if she can send them by a specific date or tell you when to expect them. Use clear, simple English and a respectful tone.
counterpart_style: You are an HR coordinator who receives many emails every day. You appreciate short, organized messages that clearly list what is needed and by when.
counterpart_context: The administrative assistant has been helping with onboarding paperwork. You mentioned last week you would send some documents but have not done so yet.
grading_focus: Focus on whether the student is polite, lists the needed documents clearly, mentions a reasonable time frame, and keeps the email organized and concise.
starter_email_generation_hint: Write a short email from the HR coordinator saying they will send some onboarding documents but not listing them all clearly or giving a specific time.
